chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry D Singleton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**11-06-15/ Judge Stephanie Rothstein**
The Court ordered the defendant to pay restitution, in the amount of $1,412.00, to be paid to Cheryl M;  the Court ordered all financial obligations and restitution to be paid through collection by the DOC from 25% of prison funds and as a condition of Extended Supervision. 
Any unpaid balance to be converted to a civil judgment. 

Hearing November 6, 2015.

Pay all applicable mandatory surcaharges, fees, assessments and costs.
*All financail obligations to be paid through collection of sums by DOC from 25% of prison funds and as a condition of Extended Supervision. To be paid by the end of supervision period.  Any remaining balance to convert to a civil judgement.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with victim Cheryl M..
No driving without valid license.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Defendant is informed he may not possess and/or own any firearms; and  he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been reinstated.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry D Singleton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (29 pages) commencing 09-14-2015 received and filed.  CH
Reflects 11-06-15 Court order for restitution in the amount of $1,412.00.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Terry D Singleton not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for restitution hearing. Restitution documentation received and filed and appended to the Victim Impact Statement. Defense does not object to the amount requested. Court ordered restitution be paid in the amount of $1,412.00 to be paid to Cheryl M. The Court ordered all financial obligations and restitution to be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.
PSI received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Court ordered the defendant remaned pending sentencing.

Negotiations placed on the record. Defendant sworn in.
As to Count 1 as amended: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

At the request of the State, the Court ordered a PSI. Order for PSI signed and filed. 

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.  All parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 case will be reassigned to Branch 25, Judge Stephanie Rothstein, in Room G55A of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defendant Terry D Singleton in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Terry D Singleton in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp for James Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered charge amended to Robbery (Use of Force)-PTAC as A Party to a Crime, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.32(1)(b), 939.50(3)(e), and 939.05 a Class E Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Terry D Singleton not in court, in custody.  
James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
  Plea hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Terry D Singleton not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request an adjournment; State needs to communicate with victim, who has been out of town.  Case continued before Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Terry D Singleton not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a date for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Terry D Singleton not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another scheduling date; received additional discovery.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:39 am.
TOT to Justice Point as previously ordered.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $7,500.00 cash.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Terry D Singleton not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived her client's appearance and requested another scheduling date, as she was just provided with additional discovery.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING proceedings commencing MARCH 6, 2015 received and filed. (16 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to ATTY. VICTORIA McCANDLESS, 819 N. 6TH, 9TH FL, MILW, WI 53203.kl
At the request of defense counsel, bail motion added to the calendar.

Defendant Terry D Singleton in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Terry D Singleton in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Kurt Ziarnik-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Cheryl M.; Deandre M. or Demaris P

Defendant Terry D Singleton in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Terry D Singleton in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
